@garrethmcdaid @nordyteacher I think you forget, we had almost eliminated community & household transmission in June, through the efforts of the public. If the right message comes from the top people have shown they will respond without coercion. It was the gov who ignored public health advice 2 weeks ago

@garrethmcdaid @nordyteacher No one wants lock-down - it’s grim and terrible. Yet Dublin City centre was deserted last night, a Thursday night when town would usually be buzzing- and this BEFORE fines are introduced ie voluntarily people follow advice, when given. That would have happened two weeks ago also

@nordyteacher @garrethmcdaid We firmly believe the public will and have followed public health advice if they are supported and persuaded of the rationale. It is the gov who ignored public health advice two weeks ago and allowed infection to multiply. Will they be fined for ignoring public health advice?

gov is bringing in laws to fine us for not obeying public health advice - they want to blame us for the rise in cases. Real problem is the mess they are making of the whole thing - evidenced by the collapse in tracing last weekend and testing this weekend. https://t.co/cebh4HkfzN
